definition:
A logic is said to have the *Beth property* if whenever a predicate $R$
is implicitly definable by $\phi$ (i.e. if all models have at most one
unique extension satisfying $\phi$), then $R$ is explicitly definable
relative to $\phi$ (i.e. there is a $\psi$ not containing $R$,such that
$\phi \models \forall x_1, .., x_n (R(x_1,...,x_n) \leftrightarrow \psi(x_1,...,x_n))$).
